intro: Neoraimondia arequipensis var. rhodantha, commonly known as the Arequipa rhodantha, is a species native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a shrub characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or semi-arid conditions. Its leaves are usually leathery and dark green, while the flowers can range from white to pinkish in color. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and adaptability to specific ecological niches.
